meanings.sent1: The sun provides us with renewable energy every day.
meanings.sent2: Using wind power is a great way to harness renewable resources.
meanings.sent3: I feel like a renewable battery that never runs out of energy!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a renewable source of happiness, always bright and never fading.
meanings.sent5: The forest seemed to have a renewable amount of green leaves, always growing back after falling.

meanings.definition: Able to be replenished or regenerated
meanings.sent1: The soil in our garden is full of renewable nutrients.
meanings.sent2: Water is a renewable source that we must protect for future generations.
meanings.sent3: His jokes were like renewable laughter, always making us smile.
meanings.sent4: The artist's creativity was a renewable well, never running dry of new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The renewable supply of fresh air in the mountains was invigorating.

meanings.definition: Relating to a natural resource that can be replaced or restored
meanings.sent1: The company invested in renewable energy to help the environment.
meanings.sent2: Planting trees is a great way to support renewable resources.
meanings.sent3: His wardrobe was like a renewable collection, always updating with new clothes.
meanings.sent4: The river was a renewable source of calm, always flowing steadily.
meanings.sent5: The renewable fields of wheat stretched as far as the eye could see.
